The next day the siblings noticed a big hole in the lab. Jane was so angry and asked their Dad why the hole was there. He calmly replied: "I had to bury all the noisy machines in the lab."
The siblings were so surprised because they hadn't noticed all the noisy machines before. They realised that Jane's warning was right all along. Even though they couldn't see the noisy machines anymore, they knew they had been there.

"Zoo! It says zoo, Lily!" Tom says. "Do you know what a zoo is?"
Lily shakes her head. She does not know what a zoo is.
"A zoo is a place where you can see many animals. They live in cages or pens. They are amazing," Tom says. "My mom took me to the zoo once. I saw a giraffe, an elephant and a snake."
"Wow, that sounds amazing, Tom. I want to see a zoo too," Lily says.
They look at the sign again. They see another word that they know: bus.

, "That slide is mine!"
Ned felt his face grow warm. He could tell that the girl was being selfish. He said softly, "Please share the slide! We'll take turns." The girl scowled but agreed.
Ned and the girl took turns sliding down the slide for the rest of the afternoon. When the sun started to melt away, the girl waved goodbye and started walking home. Ned smiled, happy that the afternoon had ended peacefully.

girl named Lily. She had a noisy pet bird named Chirpy. They loved to play together. One day, Chirpy flew away and got lost. Lily was very sad.

it was a rich pebble. He was very happy.
Tom took the pebble to his mom. She said, "Wow, that's a nice pebble!" Tom wanted to keep it safe. He put the pebble in a little box. Tom played with the pebble every day.
One day, Tom lost the pebble. He was very sad. He looked and looked for it. Then, his friend Sam came to play. They searched together. Soon, they found the pebble under a big tree. Tom was so happy to return the pebble to its box

noisy cat named Tom found a big muffin on the ground. He was very happy because he loved to eat muffins. Tom picked up the muffin and started to eat it. It was very yummy.
Tom's friend, a dog named Max, saw him eating the muffin. Max asked, "Can I have some too?" Tom said, "No, this is my muffin!" Max was sad but he waited for his turn.
Suddenly, a big bird came and took the muffin away from Tom. Tom and Max were both very surprised. They looked at each other and decided to work together to get

saw a big, red ball. The other birds were rushing to get the ball, but the lazy raven just sat and watched. He thought the ball looked fun, but he was too lazy to join the game.
Then, a little boy came and took the ball away. The other birds were sad, but the lazy raven had an idea. He decided to stop being lazy and rush to get the ball back. The lazy raven flew fast, grabbed the ball, and brought it back to the other birds. They all played happily, and the lazy raven learned that it was fun to rush and play with his friends.

ants came by the pond. They were very noisy and did not watch where they were going. They bumped into Tim, and he dropped his boat into the water.
The boat sailed away, far from Tim. He tried to catch it but he couldn't. The boat sailed too far and was lost. Tim was very sad and went back home without his boat.

One day, a boy named Tim found a toy gun. He liked to play with it and shoot at things. Tim had a friend named Max. Max and Tim liked to play war with their toy guns. They would run around and pretend to be in a big, messy war.
One sunny day, Tim and Max were playing war in the park. Tim said, "Let's hide behind the trees and shoot at each other!" Max agreed, and they both ran to their spots. As they were playing, a big wind came and

noisy queen who lived in a big castle. She loved to attach pretty things to her dress. She had many friends who liked to play with her.
One day, the queen found a small bird with a hurt wing. She wanted to help the bird, so she attached a soft bandage to the bird's wing. The bird was very happy and started to sing a pretty song.
All the queen's friends saw her help the bird and they learned to be kind too. The castle became a happy and noisy place where everyone helped each other. The moral of the story is to always be kind and help others.

Once upon a time, there was a noisy bird. The bird loved to sing all day long. It lived in a big tree near a house. The people in the house liked the bird, but sometimes it was too noisy.
One day, the bird saw some pasta on the ground. It was spring, and the people in the house were eating outside. The bird flew down and picked up the pasta with its beak. It was very happy and started to sing even louder.
The people in the house came outside to see what was happening. They saw the noisy bird with the pasta and laughed. They decided to give

!"
Ben liked the pebble too. He wanted to have it for himself. He said, "Give me the pebble, Lila. It is mine now." He tried to grab it from Lila's hand. Lila did not want to give it to him. She said, "No, Ben. It is my pebble. I found it first." She held it tight and ran away from Ben.
Ben was angry. He chased Lila and shouted, "Give me the pebble, Lila. Give me the pebble!" Lila was scared. She ran faster and

said, "Woof! We can do it! We will succeed!"
Tim and Barky tried again. They rolled a big snowball and a small snowball. They put the small one on top of the big one. This time, they succeeded! They made a big snowman, and Tim was very happy. Barky barked and jumped around the snowman, making lots of noise.
From that day on, Tim and Barky knew that if they worked together, they could succeed at anything. They lived happily in their little igloo, always ready for their next big adventure.

other dogs. The other dogs are noisy. They bark and growl. Spot does not like the noisy dogs. He feels scared.

Miss Lee comes to the yard. She smiles and says, "Hello, Ben and Lily. Who is this?" She points to Spot. Ben and Lily say, "This is Spot, our dog. He can bow. Watch!"

he settled into a cozy nest of leaves. He closed his eyes and cuddled up next to his feathers, feeling very sleepy.
Just then, a small voice called up to the parrot. It was a three year old girl, looking up in wonder at the parrot's nest. The parrot opened one eye and said, "Hello little one, why are you here?"
The girl replied, "I wanted to learn how to balance as good as you. Can you show me?"

"Give me the red block, Tom!" Lily said.
"No, it is mine!" Tom said.

One day, the noisy cloud saw a little girl. The girl was sad because she could not hear her friends. The noisy cloud felt bad for the girl. It wanted to help her.
The noisy cloud had an idea. It went down from the sky and stood next to the girl. The cloud stopped making noise. Suddenly, the girl could hear her friends again. The noisy cloud was not noisy anymore. It was a quiet cloud now. And they all lived happily ever after.

Once upon a time, there was a little girl named Sue. She had a big, old coat that she wore every day. One day, Sue went to the park to play with her friends. She saw a little cat stuck in a tree. The cat was scared and wanted to escape.
Sue said to her friends, "We need to help the cat!" They all tried to think of a way to help the cat escape from the tree. Sue looked at her old coat and had an idea. She took off her coat and

She could hear a noisy sound coming from outside. She looked out the window and saw a big truck driving by. Lucy thought the truck was very noisy.
Lucy's mom came into the room and asked, "What is that sound?" Lucy pointed to the window and said, "Big truck, Mommy! It's noisy!" Her mom smiled and said, "Yes, it is noisy. Let's close the curtain to make it less noisy."
They closed the curtain together, and the room became less noisy. Lucy was happy that her mom helped her. They both sat on the floor and played with Lucy's toys.

One day, a boy named Tim and his dog, Spot, went to play by the river. They saw a raft near the water. Tim said, "Spot, let's go on the raft and have fun!" So, they got on the raft and started to float away.
As they went down the river, they saw a mighty tree. The tree was big and tall. Tim and Spot were happy and shouted, "We love this raft ride!" They laughed and had a good time.
